text:
Guyana creates unit to make mines safer, monitor mercury use
GEORGETOWN, Guyana (AP) — Authorities in Guyana have created a special unit to ensure compliance with mining laws and monitor the use of mercury in gold mines across the South American country.
Natural Resources Minister Raphael Trotman said Friday that the unit will work alongside mine inspectors to ensure safe engineering designs and scale back the use of mercury. Officials have been encouraging miners to recover gold without using mercury to protect the environment.
